author: Staff Reporter
text:
Posing as a buyer, a man aged about 30 reportedly stole an expensive motorcycle from A. Manivel (21) of Karur, a third year student in a college in the city. About a week ago he had posted an advertisement on a popular e-commerce website that he wanted to sell the vehicle. A person called him on phone on February 15. They met near Irugur on the L&T bypass road. The ‘buyer’ took the vehicle for a test ride, and did not return.Arrested

Thirty-two, including a few girls, all activists of the All India Youth Federation, All India Students Federation, and National Federation of Indian Women were arrested for trying to block trains at the Coimbatore Junction on Sunday. The protestors sought unconditional release of Students Union President of Jawaharlal Nehru University Kanhaiya Kumar. They asked RSS, ABVP, and organisations with saffron backing to keep away from education institutions.
title: Motorcycle stolen
